channel.title: Artifactory on DevOps Engineer
channel.description: Recent content in Artifactory on DevOps Engineer

item.title: Resolving Jenkins Artifactory Plugin Artifact Upload Failure "unable to find valid certification path to requested target"
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article describes how to resolve SSL certificate validation issues when uploading artifacts from a Jenkins agent to Artifactory, including generating a security certificate file and importing it into Java’s cacerts.

item.title: Upload artifacts failed to Artifactory from AIX
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article explains how to resolve an SSL certificate verification issue on AIX when uploading artifacts to Artifactory via Jenkins, including updating Java’s cacerts file.

item.title: How to download the entire folder artifacts when Artifactory "Download Folder functionality is disabled"?
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article explains how to download the entire folder artifacts from JFrog Artifactory when the “Download Folder functionality is disabled”. It provides a workaround using Artifactory REST APIs to retrieve and download artifacts programmatically.

item.title: For Those Who Want to Use JFrog Artifactory to Manage Artifacts
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article introduces the concepts, advantages, working principles, and best practices of JFrog Artifactory, helping readers understand how to use Artifactory to manage software artifacts.

item.title: Getting Started with JFrog Artifactory
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: JFrog Artifactory is a powerful binary repository manager. This article introduces its installation, upgrade, and usage.
